transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Can I summarize that you want the todo list to feel more welcoming?
transcript.textFinal: Can I summarize that you want the todo list to feel more welcoming?

transcript.speaker: Interviewee
transcript.text: Yes, and I want the empty state to guide me on what to do next.
transcript.textFinal: Yes, and I want the empty state to guide me on what to do next.

validatedFeedback.text: Yes, and I want the empty state to guide me on what to do next.

worktrees.name: first-run-clarity
worktrees.rationale: Chosen first because the interview confirmed clarify first-run experience with explicit agreement.

worktrees.name: core-flow-efficiency
worktrees.rationale: Prepared as follow-on direction after primary changes are validated.

worktrees.name: visual-polish-speculative
worktrees.rationale: Optional polish lane after clarify first-run experience lands.

analysis.summary: This repository looks like a product-facing app with enough UI surface to run interview-driven iteration loops quickly. It appears to be built with Next.js, React, Tailwind CSS. The structure suggests a focused feature set rather than a large multi-module system.
capabilities: Frameworks detected: Next.js, React, Tailwind CSS.
State management appears to use Redux Toolkit.
Tailwind CSS is configured for rapid UI iteration.
Client-side storage usage (localStorage) appears in the codebase.

directions.title: Clarify First-Run Experience
directions.reason: New users likely need stronger orientation, especially if the product has multiple routes or configuration steps.
directions.interviewFocus: Ask what they expected to see first and which missing context would help them start faster.

directions.title: Streamline the Core Workflow
directions.reason: Primary tasks should feel faster; small friction points compound over repeated use.
directions.interviewFocus: Probe where they hesitate or take extra clicks when completing their most common task.

directions.title: Increase Feedback and Trust Signals
directions.reason: When data updates quickly, users need clear confirmation to trust the outcome.
directions.interviewFocus: Ask which actions feel uncertain and what feedback would make changes feel reliable.

directions.title: Tighten Domain-Specific Flow
directions.reason: The repo hints at domain-specific workflows that could benefit from tighter sequencing.
directions.interviewFocus: Ask how they complete the key domain task and where handoffs or missing steps appear.

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Thanks for walking through this product. I want to understand where the current experience feels slow, unclear, or frustrating.

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Let's focus on Clarify First-Run Experience. Ask what they expected to see first and which missing context would help them start faster.

lines.speaker: Interviewee
lines.text: This area slows me down today. I want a clearer, faster experience around Clarify First-Run Experience.

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Can I summarize that we should improve Clarify First-Run Experience with a clearer UI flow?

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Great. Let's capture one more priority before we move into implementation.

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Let's focus on Streamline the Core Workflow. Probe where they hesitate or take extra clicks when completing their most common task.

lines.speaker: Interviewee
lines.text: This area slows me down today. I want a clearer, faster experience around Streamline the Core Workflow.

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Can I summarize that we should improve Streamline the Core Workflow with a clearer UI flow?

lines.speaker: Interviewer
lines.text: Thanks. I have enough to draft UI-only changes and show before/after now.
